p.s: The extract from act 2 scene 2 from William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet, published in Oxford School Shakespeare in 2008, deals with Romeo secretly visiting Juliet in her garden and confessing his love to her.
Before this scene, Romeo comes to Juliet's party where they meet for the first time.
After finding out which families they belgon to they meet again at JulietsJuliet's house.
At this point of the scene Romeo is located in Juliet's garden while Juliet is standing on her balcony.
Romeo is deeply in love with Juliet.
While standing in her garden he confesses his love to her.
He tells her that nothing can hold back his love to her, even not the fact that they are both from totwo hated families.
He has big hopes that Juliet will love him back the same way he loves her.
But Juliet is scared to be catchedcaught by her family meeting Romeo eventhougheven though her love is similar to Romeo's love.
While talking Romeo trystries to convince Juliet of his feelings for her by telling her that he can proofprove his love to her by swearing.
Juliet tells him that he does not have to do that because she already loves him.
All in all Romeo is the one who is more excited for the love while on the otheother hand Juliet is a bit scared of it.
After this scene Romeo and Juliet decide to get married.
